poem:
Labubu on the Screen  

A plush chorus  
whispers through pixels,  
soft and electric—  

a universe bound  
by threads of dance  
and grin;  

a tiny empire  
where wide eyes  
gaze, entranced,  

as dreams  
woven in fiber  
breach the luminous veil,  

settling into  
the vast, eager  
embrace of light.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Labubu toy movie with potential to anchor franchise in the works at Sony Labubus could be headed to the big screen. Sony Pictures has acquired the screen rights to the plush toy sensation and is in early development of a feature film which, if successful, would anchor a new franchise. Related: Labubu for life: how did a viral doll become a ‘social currency’? Just ask these diehard fans The deal, first reported by the Hollywood". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
